meta.name: ThinkStill Canonical Actuator Library

source_meta.name: ThinkStill Ritual Engine Library (10,000 techniques)
notes: Educational coping/skills library, not medical advice.
Use user-selected condition/state labels; do not diagnose.
High-risk states: prioritize safety planning + professional support.
No delusion reinforcement; no medication directives (only 'contact clinician/prescriber').
Canonical-first library: variants are grouped under canonical actuators to prevent duplicates at generation time.
Use canonical_id for session and persistent dedupe; choose variants for intensity/style changes.
Educational coping/skills library, not medical advice. Do not diagnose. If risk escalates, seek urgent support.

dedupe.variant_dedupe: exact duplicate steps by normalized step hash within each canonical

variants.label: Gentle
steps: Name 5 things you can see.
Name 4 things you can feel (touch).
Name 3 things you can hear.
Name 2 things you can smell.
Name 1 thing you can taste (or one slow sip of water).
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

variants.label: Micro
steps: Pick a 2-minute action that helps future-you: wash one cup.
Start before you feel ready.
Do only the minimum.
Mark it complete (tick/check).
Stop—no extra goals.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

variants.label: Gentle
steps: Pick a 2-minute action that helps future-you: fold five items.
Start before you feel ready.
Do only the minimum.
Mark it complete (tick/check).
Stop—no extra goals.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

variants.label: Standard
steps: Pick a 2-minute action that helps future-you: step outside for 60 seconds.
Start before you feel ready.
Do only the minimum.
Mark it complete (tick/check).
Stop—no extra goals.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

variants.label: Micro
steps: Pick a 2-minute action that helps future-you: open one document and read 2 lines.
Start before you feel ready.
Do only the minimum.
Mark it complete (tick/check).
Stop—no extra goals.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

variants.label: Micro
steps: Pick a 2-minute action that helps future-you: drink a glass of water slowly.
Start before you feel ready.
Do only the minimum.
Mark it complete (tick/check).
Stop—no extra goals.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

steps: Pick a 2-minute action that helps future-you: make the bed (minimum).

Do only the minimum.
Mark it complete (tick/check).
Stop—no extra goals.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

steps: Pick a 2-minute action that helps future-you: wipe one small surface once.

Do only the minimum.
Mark it complete (tick/check).
Stop—no extra goals.

variants.label: Focused
steps: Notice the distortion: All-or-nothing thinking.
Write the thought in one sentence.
Ask: “What’s the evidence?” (1 fact).
Write a balanced version (1 sentence).
Do one stabilizing action: Use a 0–10 continuum.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

variants.label: Micro
steps: Notice the distortion: Catastrophizing.
Write the thought in one sentence.
Ask: “What’s the evidence?” (1 fact).
Write a balanced version (1 sentence).
Do one stabilizing action: Replace certainty with a percentage.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

canonicals.title: CBT Distortion Counter: Disqualifying the positive

variants.label: Gentle
steps: Notice the distortion: Disqualifying the positive.
Write the thought in one sentence.
Ask: “What’s the evidence?” (1 fact).
Write a balanced version (1 sentence).
Do one stabilizing action: Name one piece of positive evidence.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

variants.label: Rapid
steps: Notice the distortion: Emotional reasoning.
Write the thought in one sentence.
Ask: “What’s the evidence?” (1 fact).
Write a balanced version (1 sentence).
Do one stabilizing action: Feeling ≠ fact.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

variants.label: Standard
steps: Notice the distortion: Fortune-telling.
Write the thought in one sentence.
Ask: “What’s the evidence?” (1 fact).
Write a balanced version (1 sentence).
Do one stabilizing action: Swap prediction for possibility.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

variants.label: Standard
steps: Notice the distortion: Labeling.
Write the thought in one sentence.
Ask: “What’s the evidence?” (1 fact).
Write a balanced version (1 sentence).
Do one stabilizing action: Describe behavior, not identity.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

variants.label: Rapid
steps: Notice the distortion: Mind-reading.
Write the thought in one sentence.
Ask: “What’s the evidence?” (1 fact).
Write a balanced version (1 sentence).
Do one stabilizing action: Ask: what evidence do I have?
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

variants.label: Lite
steps: Notice the distortion: Overgeneralization.
Write the thought in one sentence.
Ask: “What’s the evidence?” (1 fact).
Write a balanced version (1 sentence).
Do one stabilizing action: Add 'today' instead of 'always'.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

variants.label: Gentle
steps: Notice the distortion: Personalization.
Write the thought in one sentence.
Ask: “What’s the evidence?” (1 fact).
Write a balanced version (1 sentence).
Do one stabilizing action: Reassign responsibility realistically.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

variants.label: Structured
steps: Notice the distortion: Should statements.
Write the thought in one sentence.
Ask: “What’s the evidence?” (1 fact).
Write a balanced version (1 sentence).
Do one stabilizing action: Swap should → prefer, then act.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

variants.label: Micro
steps: Describe what happened (facts only) in 3 lines.
Describe what you felt in 3 words.
Describe what you wanted but didn’t say.
Name the pattern you’ve seen before.
Choose one small different response next time.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

variants.label: Gentle
steps: Call a time-out: 20 minutes minimum.
Separate and downshift (breath or walk).
Return and use: “When X, I feel Y, I need Z.”
Listen back and summarize their point.
End with one repair attempt (small kindness).
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

variants.label: Gentle
steps: Choose one person to connect with.
Send a low-pressure message: “Thinking of you.”
If no reply, stop—no story.
Do one 5-minute connection this week (voice/face).
Notice mood shift after contact.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

variants.label: Deep
steps: Spot the all-or-nothing statement.
Draw a 0–10 line (0 = worst, 10 = best).
Place yourself realistically on the line.
Name one move that shifts you +1.
Do the +1 move now: wash one cup.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

variants.label: Standard
steps: Temperature shift: cool water on wrists for 10–20 seconds.
Move: 30s marching in place.
Paced breathing: inhale 4, exhale 8 for 4 cycles.
Paired relaxation: tense thighs 5s, release 15s.
Re-rate distress 0–10 and stop.
contraindications: Avoid extreme cold if you have heart issues; use mild cooling.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

Choose one stabilizing action for the next 10 minutes: drink a glass of water slowly.

variants.label: delay the compulsion
steps: Name the obsession theme in 3 words.
Choose one small exposure for 7 minutes.
Delay the compulsion for the same 7 minutes.
Notice uncertainty; do not seek certainty.
End by praising effort, not certainty.
contraindications: ERP can be intense; if severe, do with clinician.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

Delay the compulsion for the same 4 minutes.
Notice uncertainty; do not seek certainty.
End by praising effort, not certainty.
contraindications: ERP can be intense; if severe, do with clinician.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

variants.label: Deep
steps: Choose the fear cue: sit with uncertainty.
Rate fear 0–10; pick a 2–3/10 step.
Do it for 25s without safety behaviors.
Stay until fear drops a little or you learn it’s tolerable.
Repeat daily and move up the ladder.
contraindications: If severe or unsafe, do exposure with professional guidance.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

variants.label: Micro
steps: Inhale gently for 5s through the nose.
Exhale slowly for 10s.
Pause for 0s after the exhale.
Repeat for 8 cycles.
Let breath normalize naturally.
contraindications: Stop if dizzy/lightheaded.
Use gentle breathing; do not force.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

variants.label: Rapid
steps: Locate the tightest point in the body.
Increase tension by 5% on purpose for 3 seconds.
Release fully.
Notice rebound relaxation for 10 seconds.
Repeat once, then stop.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

variants.label: Lite
steps: Name the mode showing up (Critic/Protector/Vulnerable).
Name what it’s trying to protect you from.
Offer the vulnerable part one kind sentence.
Choose one adult action: wipe one small surface once.
Stop and breathe once.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

variants.label: Structured
steps: Name 5 neutral objects in the room.
State the date, time, and where you are.
Press feet into the floor for 15s, then release.
Do 4 slow breaths (long exhale).
If distress rises or you feel unsafe, contact your clinician or urgent services.
contraindications: If you feel at risk of harm, seek urgent help.
variants.safety_note: If symptoms intensify, you feel unsafe, or risk increases, contact a trusted person, your clinician, or local urgent services.

variants.label: Focused
steps: Take a normal inhale.
Top up with a second small inhale.
Exhale slowly and fully.
Repeat 5 times.
Notice the downshift and stop.
contraindications: Avoid overdoing if you feel tingling/dizziness.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

variants.label: Structured
steps: Take a normal inhale.
Top up with a second small inhale.
Exhale slowly and fully.
Repeat 4 times.
Notice the downshift and stop.
contraindications: Avoid overdoing if you feel tingling/dizziness.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.

steps: Take a normal inhale.

contraindications: Avoid overdoing if you feel tingling/dizziness.

variants.label: Gentle
steps: Define the problem in one sentence.
Brainstorm 3 options (even imperfect).
Pick the easiest option.
Do the first step in 2 minutes: make the bed (minimum).
Review tomorrow; stop for today.
variants.safety_note: If distress escalates, pause, ground physically, or seek support.
